info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 2:29PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Pike and south central Montgomery Counties through 300 PM CDT... At 229 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Daisy State Park, or 9 miles northeast of Dierks, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Glenwood... Daisy... Narrows Dam... Daisy State Park... Black Springs... Bear Creek Public Use Area... Salem in Pike County... Lodi... Langley... Nathan... Fancyhill... Hopper... Kirby... New Hope in Pike County... Rosboro... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
